If you use a lot of internet while on the road, I highly suggest you, your family and friends do NOT get this scam company! They all read from the same exact script, they will play games with you and make you run around for hours, to find out that nothing will be done! F this company I pray that someone she’s the existence out of this scam company. I am on the go everyday, when I gigs hits 17, I can no longer use my maps or anything, huge F to this sad scam company do NOT waste your time, and money on these commie clowns.

Review.Titre: Don't waste your money I have unlimited…
Review.Contenu: Don't waste your money I have unlimited service with them and my data is running at 0.10 kbps after only using 5gb of data .  Plus there customer service is almost useless

Review.Titre: Terrible service tbh, slowwwwwwww
Review.Contenu: Only get this service if you are mainly using your phone for calls. The service sucks here in Connecticut. My apps don’t even load because of how slow the internet is. It takes me 20 minutes to load one video or app. Ridiculous. Might as well pay more than to waste your time.

Review.Titre: This service is almost worthless
Review.Contenu: This service is almost worthless. The times that incoming calls go to voicemail, or just plain disappear can't be counted, but they are many. When I attempt to place outgoing calls, I frequently get a "service unavailable" note in red, or the call just goes nowhere. Even when the call does connect, it usually takes a long time to connect. Considering the number of calls that complete in a month, this service is very expensive, even at $5 per month.   Again, this service is nearly worthless. If there was a zero star option, I would mark it thus.

Review.Titre: I open a account on Nov 22 for $5
Review.Contenu: I open a account on Nov 22 for $5, absolutely worse plan for me, tried to change to $25 plan a few days later, said I must wait til Jan 22 before I could switch so here I wait for nearly 2 months so i can have a plan that will benefit me. Makes nonsense to me

Review.Titre: Hello Mobile unlimited international is…
Review.Contenu: Hello Mobile unlimited international is a scam and false advertising . It is not really unlimited. You can only call first 10 numbers international for a month. For any other calls you need to recharge and pay extra

Review.Titre: Service sucks
Review.Contenu: This service and the phone is worthless. I got it for my 11 year old and it sucks. This will be my last month with them.

Review.Titre: "Unlimited Talk and Text"

You're basically just using your talk and text til they decide to shut it off for the rest of your cycle. For some reason they seem to love me and take my texting away within about 5days into my billing cycle leaving me unable to text for 25days!!!

Review.Titre: Due date is too inconvenient and there is no customer service to help.
Review.Contenu: The rate is reasonable enough but there is no customer service to speak to it is all automated I realized I activated my plan on the wrong day of the month. I want my phone bill due on a certain day not just dt any day I wish I had not activated my plan. I will not be activating with any phone with you until I get the day of the month I can pay my bills. If this isn't settled by dec 6 then I'll quit that s company  it is unacceptable for me I dould never have hot this plan of I knew this even at five dollars!

They all say the same exact crap reading off a script and act as if they nothing about it. I pay for unlimited everything and by the 25th of every month my network would not be working except for regular text and phone calls. I am done with this scab company ripping people off, i pay for unlimited, i should have unlimited all the way until my bill is due to refill. I highly do NOT recommend this scab company.

Review.Titre: Very pathetic customer service
Review.Contenu: Very pathetic customer service. I have an issue where data is not working on my phone and every time I contact the customer care, they force me to go through the troubleshooting steps before transferring to the tech support. The troubleshooting steps are repeated every time - they are check sim number, check device compatibility, ask if phone has liquid damage, network reset, software update, manual puc configuration, device hard reset. After this they transfer the call to tech support who will raise a ticket and then ask us to wait for 48 hrs. Even after a week there is no response. Then when we contact customer care, they force us through the same checks again to transfer to tech support who will ask us to  power off and power on.  Then they’ll ask us to dial a number to check if it’s successful, then to access fast. com to check if internet is accessible. It was not. Then network settings are updated. this is repeated over and over again like a broken record. No option to request for escalation.

Review.Titre: I have been a Hello Mobile customer for…
Review.Contenu: I have been a Hello Mobile customer for quite a few years. Service has been good but the customer service is horrible. I recently brought two more phones to my plan and ever since that time the service has gotten worse for all 4 phones. Data is extremely slow and doesn’t work sometimes. Texts not going through. Trying to work with customer service has been a nightmare. They have a script they have to go through with each phone though the issue is affecting all 4 phones. I plan to try one more time to get the issue fixed and then I’ll be going to Mint Mobile.

I order a phone for my sister back in February and the address it was sent to should be the one for that phone (which is probably why she could never get it activated) and then when that was sorted out, I place the order, y'all took the money, I received no receipt to send over to sign Church, for the purchase the phone, and when I contacted your online agent they said their is not record of the purchase. But the money has come out. Y'all are thieves. You stole from a church. I really think God has a special place for people who do stuff like this.

Review.Titre: Absolutely awful customer service
Review.Contenu: Absolutely awful customer service. I was given canned answers that did nothing to help with my problem. I installed the new sim card and went out to run some errands. I get no service at home, so I wanted to test the service where it would be available. I had full bars in town, and was able to use the data and text, no problems.I then tried to make a call. The call immediately dropped and the bars showed empty. Within a minute, the bars were back to full. I tried again, with the same result.I tried both the chat, and calling customer service. The chat person insisted that the problem was I had not "turned on wifi calling" in order to make calls *while at home where I have no service.* which is not at all what I wanted. She did not seem to comprehend my repeated explanations that the phone was dropping calls in areas with FULL BARS OF SERVICE.The telephone representative wasn't much better. I had to give him an address in town. Where I have service. To get him to check coverage- which he confirmed what I had already explained that I had FULL SERVICE in that area. He then proceeded to take my IMEI number... and tell me that the phone "isn't compatible" with the network. Even though the checker on the website says the phone is fine, and I was able to partially access the service- data and text, with the phone. It is only calls that were dropping.I'm canceling this and will absolutely not be recommending Hello Mobile to anyone. I have used several pay-as-you-go services in the past and have never dealt with this level of incompetence.

Review.Titre: I've been with Hello Mobile since March 20th 2021
Review.Contenu: I've been with Hello Mobile since March 20th 2021, and the only customer reward I've received from them is a free second month of data, which I received after first joining the mobile service. It's now September 19th 2023. So this happened 2 years ago. I have not seen a customer reward since. I really wish Hello Mobile would reward their loyal customers more, with maybe another free month of data or maybe a gift card as a thank you. I also wish that their network speed would improve. My speed really began slowing down back in November of 2022 and I was nowhere near my data limit. Now, whenever I browse using my mobile plan, it sometimes takes a decade for webpages to load or to play a YouTube video. I found out that US Mobile offers a free $25 prepaid card to their first time customers that they can use toward their monthly bill. So that means this company gives money to customers who might not even stay with them or become a loyal customer. I can't even get a reward like that from Hello Mobile and I am a loyal customer who pays every month. I wish Hello Mobile would do even better than US Mobile and offer their loyal paying customers a $25 or maybe even a $50 Visa gift card. That would be nice and it would help a loyal customer spread the word and recommend Hello Mobile. It's a bit confusing how first time customers using another mobile service gets treated better than a loyal customer who uses Hello Mobile.

Review.Titre: Probably the most affordable cell…
Review.Contenu: Probably the most affordable cell service around. $5 per month for unlimited call/text with 500MB data is hard to beat. I haven't had any issues with call/txt reception. The 2nd month is also free which is a nice little bonus. They also didn't outright cancel my service when my credit card info changed but I forgot to update the payment info on their site. However they didn't notify me either about the payment issue. I had to contact them.Unfortunately that's where all the pros end. Everything else is pretty subpar. Their website is very basic and some things have issues; I changed my password and it took like 15 min. for the changes to go through. I could still login with my old password for that period which could be a potential security issue.Customer service is unsurprisingly lacking and their reps noticeably stick to a script. Their mobile app had a dangerous security issue a couple years ago allowing anyone who had your phone number to access your personal info, account no., history of calls/text, without any password. Even after being notified it took them months to act on this. They didn't even fix the issue they simply disabled the app. Extremely negligent and irresponsible. I'm not sure if they re-released the app but I wouldn't take the chance of using it.Wifi calling does not work on Hello Mobile. This was confirmed by their customer service. Although one person I talked to said it did work for them on their iphone so Idk. I use a moto phone.Data usage is hard capped I believe.If all you need is dirt cheap calling and txt messaging  then you might consider this. If you want more features (like wifi calling and probably a lot of others) and value good customer service this is absolutely not it. The negligence with their mobile app and site's functionality is also troubling and tells me they don't place high priority on security.  I'm giving this service 2.5 stars.

Review.Contenu: Calls mostly go to voicemail. I always find myself returning calls or missing important calls.

Review.Titre: The price is great compared to Verizon
Review.Contenu: The price is great compared to Verizon. But, compared to Verizon, the places I need it to work, not so great.

Review.Titre: The website had problems with multiple key aspects
Review.Contenu: The website had problems with the shipping address for the SIM card. After selecting another address I was able to proceed in placing my order. Shortly thereafter I received an e-mail saying they had problems with my credit card. Not off to a great start.

Review.Titre: Changing cell providers
Review.Contenu: My son got married and wanted to move his phone number to the provider his wife uses because she had better service.   We went through the steps and could never get his number ported to the new provider.    This is very poor customer service and makes me wonder if we need to move the remaining lines.   We started with 4 lines and are now down to 2 lines due to poor service and no help except through the darn chat bots which is poor.

Review.Titre: Switched from Cricket after many very…
Review.Contenu: Switched from Cricket after many very satisfied Years of Service..  Simply to try to Cut back during these Difficult Financial Years ! Have now been with Hello Mobile for 3-4 months...Lots of Bumps to be Resolved by Hello Mobile Yet. I Certainly hope it Continues though because I want to Like Hello Mobile for their reasonable Cost and Eventually reliable Service??!!!

Review.Titre: Everything slow
Review.Contenu: I put the order in last Thursday but got a confirmation the following Tuesday, even though when I chatted on Monday it was in the system.  The chat was of no help since she couldn't give me a clue when the simm card would be shipped.  Still waiting for it to get shipped after 5 days. Good thing this is only a backup phone

Review.Titre: Give Value but with Limitations.
Review.Contenu: 500 MB of data and unlimited calls and text for $5 is a good deal.  Despite what the coverage map shows, there are areas of no coverage within a mile of my home.  And there is limited coverage in my own house.  I had a flat tire in February and needed to contact AAA.  There was no coverage where my car was parked and I had to walk in the cold to find minimal coverage.  Hello Mobile is OK as a 2nd phone; but my Spectrum coverage is much better and that's my primary phone.

Review.Titre: I had trouble setting up the sim card
Review.Contenu: I had trouble setting up the sim card, the instructions were pretty easy to follow, I punched in all information from the pamphlet into the phone, I had trouble with service, I played around sending text messages to my boyfriend's phone, I had to speak with customer service... after some trial and error and testings they said my phone was not compatible with their service. I said that's not true, I punched in the IMEI number before purchasing a sim card and it said the phone was compatible. Meanwhile, the text messages are coming thru whole I'm talking to customer service. My area has terrible reception no matter what service provider. But customer service keeps telling me to replace the phone. Otherwise, their plans are priced perfectly.

Review.Titre: All is fine except internet speed
Review.Contenu: The only problem is the internet speed. It is unstable. Sometime it drops for the weeks until the new period starts. And the worst in these cases are helpless customer support. They try to restore and reset the connection that takes huge amount of time, but there is nothing wrong with the connection - the only reason for slow internet speed is artificial lowering of speed from your side. But for some reason no one can tell what amout of GB is maximum for the unlimited plan before the speed will be lowered. That's my biggest concern. And this problem appears a number of times a year. There was no any problem on July and August, but for the half of May and June the speed was lowered to 0.01 mbps.

Review.Titre: Wasted setup time because a duplicated SIM order
Review.Contenu: I received the SIM card just a few days after placing the order, which was really nice. However, when I inserted it into my new phone, it didn't work. I called the support team and reviewed all the standard procedures to escalate the issue to the next tier. Eventually, I was connected to a second-tier support agent who seemed to be more knowledgeable than the first one. After reviewing the issue, he explained that the SIM was invalid due to a duplicate order. Apparently, they had sent a second SIM after the first one had already shipped, and the new number was assigned to the second SIM, making the first one invalid. It took me about two hours to figure all of this out, and I really wish I had known to ignore the first SIM from the start. In the end, the second SIM worked just fine.

Review.Titre: It would be nice to get a deal on a new…
Review.Contenu: It would be nice to get a deal on a new phone for being a customer for over 3 yrs now. I'm having to use my tablet as my phone becuz I can't afford a phone that's unlocked that I can afford at the moment. Love the unlimited $25 plan and had it the whole I've had your service.

Review.Titre: A few months back
Review.Contenu: A few months back, at the end of the month my data would slow down so much I couldn't even text or use the dam phone, really made me mad, like you were holding me hostage. When you say unlimited data mean unlimited data, then you will get more stars!

Review.Titre: The service is decent
Review.Contenu: The service is decent. I just wish that the service wouldn't slow down my speed when I get close to 2GB out of my 4GB data plan. Webpages won't even load up. I also wish that Hello Mobile would offer some rewards to their loyal customers, like me. I've been a customer with Hello Mobile since March 19th, 2021. Maybe Hello Mobile can give their long time customers some incentives or free unlimited data for one month for being a valued customer. Something along those lines. Maybe even a gift card for being a good paying customer. I think that would help loyal customers spread the word so that Hello Mobile can attract new customers, because they'll want to join in on those customer rewards.

Review.Titre: It works, but read on...
Review.Contenu: 3.5 stars. Fast SIM delivery, but a chat in early September revealed that new account setup could only be done from a lap- or desktop. It was maddening (!!) to get no error online that said so and then to only learn the deal --after-- wasting a bunch of time and stress trying to order via mobile and tablet--which was all I had at the time! It took the dogged persistence (spread across 2+ weeks) of personal attempts, a 40-minute support call and 2 chat sessions to activate my Hello Mobile account on an Alcatel Axel 5004R + number both unlocked from AT&T. Signal strength inside my WDC home is weakish. At times calls take 5-10s to connect. Or, they fail, get dropped, and I have to retry 3-5X. What happens when I travel is yet to be seen... **H-O-W-E-V-E-R**, I do not regret the choice. The techs who dealt with me did their best and were cool. For the savings and seems-OK-enough reliability, my high-ish tolerance can take it.

Review.Titre: The signup process was pretty simple…
Review.Contenu: The signup process was pretty simple but I was not able to copy paste my password into the password field. I use a password manager and I don't want to type my randomly generated 64 character password.

Review.Titre: Service and reception are good
Review.Contenu: Service and reception are good. But unlimited plan data is not unlimited, have a cap on it. Be careful not to used up your data, you will be sorry if you do. The speed will be ridiculous slow, as slow can not even use your gps, if you lucky enough you still can send a text and don’t even think of browse on the internet. I do understand the cap, but I expect they allow you to use the gps at least.

Review.Titre: Hello mobile don’t give guest break
Review.Contenu: Hello mobile don’t give guest break, when you travel to overseas for a month or two, you still need pay your bills, they can’t hold your numbers, this need improve.

Review.Titre: Mobile data experience is poor
Review.Contenu: My service has had some recent issues. My calls and texts have awesome reliability however, recently my mobile data connection has been terrible. I can hardly browse when I'm not on Wi-Fi. Fortunately my map still works but if I need information on the go, the mobile data is suddenly unreliable.

Review.Titre: Some times I cannot respond a phone…
Review.Contenu: Some times I cannot respond a phone call. The incredible amount of commercial on the screen are difficult to remove. When I get trough, the call is gone.Thinking about switching companies soon if this does not change.

Review.Contenu: My hotspot used to work and now it does not fir some reason. I have the same plan that I used to have. The coverage is less par than other carriers and my data can get very slow and my wife loses hers sometimes even though we have unlimited data. The only reason I stay with hello is because the price is very good and I like to bring over my own phone.

Also there is no option for eSIM. I wan to use my iPhone 14 but it does not have a physical SIM so I have to use an older phone that has a slot for physical SIM.

Review.Titre: glitchy and unpredictably irregular…
Review.Contenu: glitchy and unpredictably irregular servicecheap is great, but wouldn't mind paying more for something less sketchynow that Verizon has "visible", I'm afraid "HELLO Mobile" is going to lose customers

Review.Contenu: Due to recycled numbers, getting a lot of spam calls. Otherwise, it's alright so far. Really affordable for sure.

Review.Contenu: I’ve had the service 2 months now. The service works great on wifi but without wifi I can barely ever get good enough service to use my gps or social media. If I start my gps on wifi it’s good to get me where I need to go but if I’m already out and about it takes forever or just never loads the map/directions l. Same with searching or social media. There are a few places I’ve noticed that I’ve had all my bars/5g but very few. But I’ve searched everywhere and this is the cheapest service you can get.

Review.Contenu: love the price, even had two lines.....BUT could never connect when  I am inside my home, walk outside , no problem, still o cheap, hate to give it up, plus have had that number for over 12 yrs.

Review.Contenu: In general, Hello is good.  What is bad is that only I can get service.  Seems to be limited to one account per mailing address.  Makes no sense to me.  I always worry about a business whose operation makes no sense.

Review.Contenu: Customer Support needs to be improved, still, we need to get a direct customer support number. I have purchased the unlimited data plan, really I did not get unlimited data, Certainly, it does not work, even we can even send messages or work with Whatsapp.

Review.Contenu: Great rates and quick support when we need it. I had 2 lines with "Hello" (myself and my wife). However, due to my job, I use a little more data than my wife (between 6-8GB). As soon as I reached 5GB, "Hello" slowed down my data to the point that nothing was loading. I'm willing to pay extra if I have the option to purchase additional data or a more advanced plan with up to 10GB.

Review.Titre: mixed opinions but it is too early to tell
Review.Contenu: Getting set up on the hello mobile site was super easy. I ended up getting a new number even though I have had the same number for close to 20 years give or take but I am no longer in the state that my old number was from. I have had my hello mobile phone for less than a week and here is my honest opinion:The phone: Beings I broke my old phone ( samsung galaxy a51) I needed something fast and cheap. I ended up getting the Hot Pepper serrano3 phone and honestly I 1000% HATE the phone but it was what I could afford just to get me by until I can afford a better phone. The phone itself is very touchy and unresponsive a lot of the time especially if I am trying to look at my bank accounts, bus app, or uber. I have had to take the battery out multiple times a day and restart the phone. Just today (November 21,2023) It rebooted itself while I was trying to get my crew app that I use for work going after I was sent the link Sunday night ( it literally took that long for me to get the text message for the link). I don't know if it is the service OR the phone. IF you need a starter phone that is for the very basic needs of making calls and taking calls its okay at best but wouldn't advise getting this phone if you like to play games on your phone and for social media purposes. I hope to get a new phone soon because I am about to toss this phone out a ten story building window. Maybe with time it will cooperate but in the mean time the Hot Pepper Serrano 3 is not a phone I would get ever again.The service:I made a phone call earlier and while I was on a call somehow my phone dialed the number again which was weird again it may be the phone itself. I will say the sim card worked right away after inserting it into the phone but I wasn't quite impressed with the quality of the sim card ( cheap flimsy plastic) when the sim card from my old phone was metal ( guess I just got to get used to that) The data seems to be fine for the most part however I am in situations where I use wifi most of the time. To start i got the 15 dollar plan which for the time being is enough until I renew the service in which I may go with a different plan for the simple fact that I do use the transit app for my area to catch the bus and I need something with a lot of data for that reason or reasons if I am out of a wifi accessible area. The call that I did make however was rather clear. The other issue I seem to have is not receiving text messages right away. For verification codes it comes in okayish but again the text my manager sent to my phone with a link to my crew app took about a day and a half. Again I don't know if it is the phone or the service. I know it has only been a handful of days so only time will tell if things will improve or not but I am hopeful it will because I like the concept of Hello Mobile and if the service works better than this super. I am also considering that the phone is a 4glte phone and not 5g so that may have something to do with it so maybe with a better phone the service will improve. I am not going to discredit them just yet especially since the plans are really affordable. My boyfriend's daughter just ordered a sim card for a bring your own phone plan through Hello Mobile. When she gets it we will see if she has better service or if the issues are still the same. I know my review isn't exactly fair since I am a new customer BUT I will give a new review once I have had the service a little longer. I will say that having the second month free is really cool and your account is very easy to navigate through. If you do end up getting a phone through Hello Mobile I will say go through all the apps and get rid of what you know you won't use. I had to with the Serrano 3 because it has very limited space. that is the other reason I want to get a better phone.

Review.Titre: I got $25 unlimited but it's a scam! There is limit after 2 g of use
Review.Contenu: I decided to check them out because of unlimited for $25 . They never could give me exactly numbers when will it slow down as some reps say 15 g and some say after excessive use of data.. I decided to see what is real story behind the $25 unlimited.  The porting my # to them was pretty simple but still when calling 611 said my service past due but my service paid off for 2 months.  I started testing Speed with my s21Ultra I got up to 100 mbps. But it was only until I reached 2g of use of data and then it dropped to 5-7 mbps speed.. I even called them but they use support team who does same network reset but nothing happened until I reached 5g of data used.. then the speed dropped to 1mbps. And I assume it will drop even more soon ... I guess their $25 plan is just not really unlimited 4 or 5 g plan as they put limit pretty quick on it. The support service is horrible as you can't hear them as they talk out of bathroom or in airport... I hope it will help you to decide

Review.Titre: I recently switched to Hello Mobile
Review.Contenu: I recently switched to Hello Mobile, and overall, my experience has been fairly positive. Here's a breakdown of my thoughts on the service:Pros:Affordable Plans: Hello Mobile offers competitive pricing, making it an attractive option for budget-conscious users. The plans provide a good balance of data, talk time, and text messages at reasonable rates.Coverage: The coverage has been reliable in most urban areas, and I haven't experienced any major issues with dropped calls or poor signal quality. However, it's essential to check the coverage map to ensure it meets your needs in specific locations.Simple Activation Process: Setting up the service was straightforward, and I appreciated the ease of activation. The SIM card arrived quickly, and I was able to start using the service without any significant hiccups.Customer Service: While I haven't had many issues, the customer service I've encountered has been responsive. They addressed my inquiries in a timely manner and were generally helpful.Cons:Data Speeds: The data speeds can be inconsistent, especially during peak hours. Streaming or downloading large files may not be as smooth as with some other providers. It's essential to manage your expectations regarding data speed.Limited International Features: If you frequently travel internationally, Hello Mobile might not be the best choice. The international features are somewhat limited, and roaming charges can add up quickly.App Functionality: The mobile app, while functional, could use some improvements in terms of user interface and features. It lacks some of the conveniences provided by larger carriers.Hidden Fees: Keep an eye out for potential hidden fees that may not be immediately apparent when signing up. Some users have reported unexpected charges that weren't clearly outlined in the initial plan details.In conclusion, Hello Mobile is a decent option for individuals seeking a budget-friendly phone plan with reliable coverage in most areas. While it may not have all the bells and whistles of larger carriers, it serves its purpose well for those who prioritize affordability. However, there's room for improvement in terms of data speeds, international features, and app functionality.

Review.Titre: Embracing Connectivity: Why I Love Hello Mobile
Review.Contenu: I love Hello Mobile for several reasons. Firstly, the reliable nationwide coverage gives me peace of mind, ensuring that I stay connected wherever I am in the US. The free international calling to over 60 countries is a fantastic perk, allowing me to stay in touch with friends and family abroad without worrying about additional charges.The option to keep my current phone and number with Hello Mobile is convenient, and the 'Always On' guarantee ensures that I can always send texts and make 911 calls even if I run out of minutes or data. The total online support is a standout feature, providing assistance without the need for physical storefronts, resulting in cost savings that are passed on to the customers.Additionally, the Wi-Fi Auto-Connect™ feature is a smart way to maximize my wireless plan by automatically connecting to one of the 10 million nationwide Hotspots, helping me save on data usage and costs. Overall, Hello Mobile offers a comprehensive and affordable wireless experience, making it my preferred choice for staying connected.
